@adoroszlai Thanks for merging the patch.  I have noticed that the Author is different in the merged patch

Author: Naresh Bhat <nareshgbhat@users.noreply.github.com>

it should be

Author: Naresh Bhat <naresh.bhat@linaro.org>

Is it possible to update the patch with git author command ?  I am not sure how it got modified.
and also I have added description and signoff which is missing in the patch.  The patch must have looked as below,

Author: Naresh Bhat <naresh.bhat@linaro.org>
Date:   Tue May 29 14:31:39 2018 +0530

    ambari: Add jdeb support
    
    This patch add jdeb (debian) package creation support for the following
    packages.
    -ambari-funtest
    -ambari-logsearch
    -ambari-metrics-grafana
    -utility
    
    Signed-off-by: Naresh Bhat <naresh.bhat@linaro.org>

...
..........

After adding description, signoff.  Is it possible to cherry-pick the same patch on v2.6 branch ?

Hey @vishalsuvagia, could you give an example where blueprint deployment fails with the original code but succeeds with yours?

To add it to `branch-2.6`, please cherry-pick locally, and open a new PR.

The noreply address is used if "Keep my email address private" is enabled in your settings.  I can try choosing "Rebase and merge" next time and see if it keeps the original commit's email address.

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/Ambari-Github-PullRequest-Builder/2896/
Test PASSed.

Hi @benyoka, Thank-you for the concern.
When Atlas-Server is to be installed on two or more than hosts, the blueprint processor tries to replace the value of property [atlas.server.bind.address](https://github.com/apache/ambari/blob/trunk/ambari-server/src/main/resources/common-services/ATLAS/0.1.0.2.3/configuration/application-properties.xml#L121-L122) with the [f.q.d.n](https://github.com/apache/ambari/blob/trunk/ambari-server/src/main/java/org/apache/ambari/server/controller/internal/BlueprintConfigurationProcessor.java#L3156) of the host where Atlas is to be installed, this leads to error as the blueprint-processor is unable to resolve which host should be used to populate the property atlas.server.bind.address.
Ideally the value for atlas.server.bind.address is resolved internally on the [agent side](https://github.com/apache/ambari/blob/trunk/ambari-server/src/main/resources/common-services/ATLAS/0.1.0.2.3/package/scripts/params.py#L155-L156), so the value should not be processed by the blueprint-processor.

@vishalsuvagia Isn't `atlas.server.bind.address` configurable by the user?  It seems to me that it is always overwritten at the agent side, so this shouldn't be a config property in the first place.

Closing the issue as it seems there is a work-around for the issue, Adding property `atlas.server.bind.address` in the blueprint with value as 0.0.0.0 seems to fix the problem.
retest this please

Test FAILured.

It looks like the `SingleHostTopologyUpdater` prevents `ATLAS_SERVER` from being placed in multiple host groups.  Other HA components (eg. NameNode, Hive Metastore, etc.) have hard-coded logic, but Atlas Server runs into the `IllegalArgumentException`:

https://github.com/apache/ambari/blob/cc5e30c6350446c323fe5595691289b1af8332d0/ambari-server/src/main/java/org/apache/ambari/server/controller/internal/BlueprintConfigurationProcessor.java#L1866-L1946

cc-ing, @benyoka because I remember he mentioned that some stack code in the HDF parses existing command jsons for some weird reasons and maybe this change will break that.
Parsing command JSON shouldn't really be done as we are free to change that structure at will. I don't think it was ever meant to be a contract.

Yeah, I noticed:
```
  File "/var/lib/ambari-agent/cache/stacks/HDP/3.0/services/YARN/package/scripts/params_linux.py", line 322, in <module>
    yarn_registry_dns_principal_name = yarn_registry_dns_principal_name.replace('_HOST', hostname.lower())
  File "/usr/lib/ambari-agent/lib/resource_management/libraries/script/config_dictionary.py", line 73, in __getattr__
    raise Fail("Configuration parameter '" + self.name + "' was not found in configurations dictionary!")
resource_management.core.exceptions.Fail: Configuration parameter 'yarn.registry-dns.principal' was not found in configurations dictionary!
```

So we need anoither solution.
